intro: Uvifera leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed uvifera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
